I also think B

B sounds radical, that affects to all users. C in my opinion is not correct, you can fix an issue by deleting usage data but not reimporting it again. The given answer is correct, it happen with a couple of customers when they upgrade platform in D365, i think was platform 12
I think it should be the option B.
it happend to me some days ago. Deleting and recreating the query solved the issue

In my opinion, more than one answer is right. The performance problem is a known issue with IE11. So the first and quickest solution could really be, to try another Browser like Edge or Chrome. If the problem further exists, I would try to go the way discribed in answer C. Bad question :-/
Internet Explorer is a valid browser for D365. Delete to see if this resolves the problem, re- importing the changes immediately won't allow for checking if the problem is resolved.

comments.content: It counts as a supported browser because Microsoft didn't have another as they started with D365 :-D But the performance issues in the beginning with IE was really ugly.

discussion.content: they switched up this question, the browser involved was Microsoft edge, in that scenario, option A of switching browser from Internet explorer becomes invalid, As I don't think the question was a typo, the option of Delete the sales form object in the usage data form seems most correct
I would suggest B. It is said that a user personalized the form
A is correct because no other users are reporting issues if all users are reporting issue then C would be correct

comments.content: We don't know what browser other users are using.
This user is not the only one using IE 11

To remove personalizations. Click the Delete all personalizations button on the Personalization tab of the Usage data form.

discussion.content: B delete sales form object from usage data.
Agree, I would pick "Delete the sales form object in the usage data form"

questions.answer_description:
Note:
There are several versions of this question in the exam. The question has two possible correct answers:
1. Switch to Microsoft Edge instead of Internet Explorer 11.
2. Reset all the usage data for the user.
Other incorrect answer options you may see on the exam include the following:
1. Disable and then re-enable the user.
2. Rebuild the system indexes.
questions.question_text:
You are a Dynamics 365 Finance system administrator.
A user is reporting an issue with the Sales Order form. The UI for the form is not loading properly, and there are some performance issues. The object was working fine until the most recent update release. The user has personalized this form, is using Microsoft Internet Explorer 11, and no other users are reporting issues.
You need to resolve the issue.
What should you do?

choices.A: Switch to Microsoft Edge instead of Internet Explorer 11.
choices.B: Delete the sales from object in the usage data form.
choices.D: Reimport and compile the AOT object causing issues.
choices.C: Export, delete, then reimport the usage data for the sales from object.

questions.question_text:
You are a Dynamics 365 Finance developer.
New features for Dynamics 365 Finance have been released. Your company plans to upgrade their Dynamics 365 instance soon.
You need to download a virtual machine that includes all of the new features so that you can explore the new features.
Where should you go?

comments.content: I download VHD 10.0.17 several months ago. and Installed Hyper-V already locally and deploy to Azure via LCS. So I think answer is B here.

discussion.content: New VM can be download from B
B. VHDs are available on Shared library

Selected Answer: B
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/dev-tools/vhd-setup

Selected Answer: C
The VHD is always several versions lagging behind the latest version, so I doubt B is correct.

Selected Answer: B
The “Environments” option in Dynamics 365 Finance is typically used to manage your existing environments, such as creating, deleting, or resetting environments12. However, it does not provide the functionality to download a virtual machine that includes all of the new features of Dynamics 365 Finance. For that purpose, you would need to go to the Shared Asset library

Selected Answer: B
"You need to download a virtual machine that includes all of the new features so that you can explore the new features." So, Download (as a locally running VM), not Deploy (as a clout-based environment), and this is obviously from Shared asset library in LCS. Also, cloud-based development environments should be updated after the UAT/Prod is updated, otherwise these would not be useable for further deployments.

Selected Answer: C
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/dev-tools/access-instances

Shared asset library is used for on-prem/ locally running machine and Environmments is used for deploying VHD on cloud. 
I would recommend envrionmnets since its not specified that its cloud or on-prem

Selected Answer: B
The Shared Asset Library in Lifecycle Services (LCS) is where Microsoft provides downloadable resources such as virtual hard disks (VHDs) with Dynamics 365 Finance pre-installed. You can download a VHD from the Shared Asset Library to explore new features in a virtual machine.

Selected Answer: C
NO ITS C

https://community.dynamics.com/ax/b/axinthefield/posts/how-to-download-a-dynamics-365-finance-and-operations-onebox-virtual-machine#:~:text=How%20to%20Download%20a%20Dynamics%20365%20Finance%20and,VHD%20to%20a%20local%20folder.%20...%20More%20items

C

The correct option to download a virtual machine that includes all of the new features of Dynamics 365 Finance so that you can explore the new features is:

C. Environments

You should go to the Dynamics 365 Finance environments page to download the virtual machine that includes all of the new features. The environments page is available in the Microsoft Power Platform admin center, and you can use it to manage and provision environments for Dynamics 365 Finance.
For new features, you use Environments, where as for downloading Virtual Machine in existing instance (For ex: Tier 2 or 3 or 4 environments), you used Shared Asset Library.

answers should be B, even if you go into another environment, you still need to upgrade it since the question stated that a new version has been introduced, you still need get access to the new version which is found in asset library to try it out

https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/dev-tools/access-instances#vm-that-is-running-locally

Power BI is not correct. Alerts referred to in this video apply only to threshold-type rules on Single number, KPI or Gauge tiles. e.g we've hit $20,000 in sales. It does not alert for new sales orders.
D. Power automate is only correct answer. 
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/power-bi/create-reports/service-set-data-alerts

Poorly worded question.

New sales orders must be evaluated every hour. Warehouse operations managers must be sent an email alert to include new sales orders. The solution must not include custom code development.
You need to use a Power Platform product to implement the solution.
Which product should you use?
